newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Jan 16.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Jan 16.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
Senior leaders stress importance of mutual support between government and army and between the army and the people.
Many Chinese regions successfully meeting compulsory nine years education and anti-illiteracy targets, but work to improve education expected to be even harder in future.
China has long way to go to develop steel industry despite becoming world's largest producer.
Local official in Hunan province expelled from Communist Party for corruption.
China invests 21.5 billion yuan in construction of irrigation systems.
China's construction industry to focus on increase supply and boost sales of housing.
China's strategic missile troops improve techniques used to establish forward positions.
- Officials nationwde shut down 25 illegal laser disc production lines and arrest suspects accused of producing or selling pirated and pornographic products.
- Vice Premier Jiang Chunyun urges township enterprises to boost efficiency to maintain growth, saying many firms have low productivity and are poorly managed.
